END OF DAY SUMMARY - January 28, 2026 (Fed Day).

SESSION OVERVIEW: Monitored portfolio from 2:00 PM to 4:01 PM through FOMC rate decision. Fed held rates steady, economic view improved, signaled pause on cuts. Market rallied on presser then faded slightly into close.

TRADES EXECUTED:
1. BUY SPY 1/30 $695C x5 at $3.86 (scalp) — 2:01 PM
2. SELL SPY 1/30 $695C x5 at $3.73 (scalp exit) — 3:06 PM. Realized loss: -$65 (-3.4%). Closed per rules: no overnight hold on 2 DTE.

OVERNIGHT POSITIONS:
- NVDA 2/20 $190C x5: -$25 (-0.6%), 23 DTE, ITM
- SPY 2/20 $697C x5: -$545 (-10.7%), 23 DTE, OTM by ~$1.20

DAILY P/L: ~-$55 realized + ~-$570 unrealized = -$625 total mark-to-market.
DAILY LOSS %: -0.63% (well within -5% circuit breaker).

RULES COMPLIANCE:
- Limit orders only: YES
- Position sizing <15%: YES (largest position $5,075 = 5.1%)
- Max 10 positions: YES (2 positions)
- Scalps closed by EOD: YES
- Daily loss <5%: YES (-0.63%)
- Decision logging: YES (4 decisions logged)

NOTES: SPY swing hit -14.9% intraday but recovered to -10.7% by close. Held through the danger zone due to 23 DTE and intact bullish thesis. Fed day volatility was manageable. Scalp was modest loss, correctly closed per rules.
